intro: Cynoglossum mannii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that resemble bells. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Cynoglossum mannii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
